[
  {
    "id": "bd-test-001",
    "code": "pXa-01",
    "title": "Recover bead details and restore load path",
    "priority": "P0",
    "depends_on": [],
    "how_to_think": "This bead is a debugging and recovery task. The intent is to determine why bead metadata failed to load and to restore the bead-info retrieval path without introducing side effects. Preserve idempotency: any retries or recovery actions should not duplicate records or mutate state unexpectedly. Keep changes additive and low-risk—prefer logging, guardrails, and clearer error surfaces over invasive refactors. Stop and escalate if the root cause points to missing upstream data (e.g., bead store corruption, permissions, missing secrets) or if fixing it requires schema changes or broad architectural decisions; in that case, produce a minimal diagnostic report and propose the smallest next bead(s).",
    "acceptance_criteria": [
      "Given bd-test-001, the system successfully loads and displays bead title/description/status (no 'Failed to load' error) in the primary read path",
      "If loading fails for any bead, the error includes a clear root-cause hint (HTTP status/exception class) and a correlation identifier in logs"
    ],
    "files_to_create": [
      "docs/debug/bead-load-failure-bd-test-001.md"
    ],
    "files_to_modify": [
      "scripts/bridge/bridge-agent-loop.sh",
      "scripts/agent-mail-helper.sh"
    ],
    "verification": [
      "Docker-first: run the bridge/agent stack the same way production does (docker compose up -d if applicable) and then trigger a bead load for bd-test-001; alternatively run the exact bead read command used by your system (e.g., ./scripts/<bead-read>.sh bd-test-001).",
      "Expected: bead metadata resolves (non-empty title/description) and logs include either a success line with bead id or, on failure, a structured error with status/exception and correlation id."
    ]
  }
]
